title: A look at how we're building more sustainable hardware - The Keyword | Google Product and Technology News
summary: Google is making efforts to reduce its environmental impact by increasing the use of recycled materials in its products, like Pixel 7, and reducing its packaging's plastic content.  They also partnered with iFixit to provide genuine Pixel spare parts and documentation for customers to repair their phones, extending the lifespan of their devices.  Google aims to eliminate plastic from its hardware product packaging by 2025 and reduce its carbon footprint through these sustainable practices.
product_or_process: Pixel 7, recycled materials, packaging, phone repair program
greenwashing: The article does not provide evidence of greenwashing, instead highlighting genuine efforts towards environmental sustainability and transparency in their practices.

title: Why is recycling so important? The dirty truth behind our trash - ZME Science
summary: Recycling is a crucial process that involves collecting, sorting, and remanufacturing waste materials into new products. It offers numerous environmental, economic, and social benefits, such as reducing landfill waste, conserving natural resources, saving energy, creating jobs, and protecting wildlife.  By reducing our consumption and reusing items whenever possible, we can further minimize waste and promote sustainability.

greenwashing: The article promotes genuine recycling practices and doesn't provide evidence of greenwashing.

title: BRIDGESTONE DEVELOPS TIRE USING 75% RECYCLED AND RENEWABLE MATERIALS INCLUDING RECYCLED ... - PR Newswire
summary: Bridgestone Americas has created demonstration tires using 75% recycled and renewable materials, including recycled plastics and natural rubber from desert shrubs. The company is working with automakers to test these tires on electric SUVs and crossovers, and is also developing tires with 90% recycled and renewable materials for passenger cars.  Bridgestone aims to use 100% sustainable materials in its products by 2050.
product_or_process: Tires made with 75% recycled and renewable materials

title: Setting Buy Clean Standards to Green US Steel - Rocky Mountain Institute
summary: The article discusses the need for effective Buy Clean standards to decarbonize the US steel industry.  These standards aim to incentivize low-carbon steel production while avoiding unintended consequences like driving domestic steelmakers out of business. The author proposes a flexible approach where emissions standards are adjusted based on the recycled content of steel products, thereby promoting both emissions reductions and fair competition.
